author: from staff reports
title: Allegany cruises over Keyser
text:
Allegany cruises over Keyser from staff reports The Cumberland Times-News 
CUMBERLAND — Six different players scored for the Allegany offense and the Campers defense allowed only one shot Thursday during a 6-0 Appalachian Mountain Athletic Conference win over Keyser at Greenway Avenue Stadium. 
Ryan Campbell, Dylan Robertson, Cooper Willetts, Brennan Ives, Blake Geatz and Carter Willetts all scored for the Campers, while Geatz, had two assists, and Cooper Willetts, Kobe Bosley and Brandon McCloskey each had one. 
Campbell was assisted by Geatz for the only goal of the first half, and Robertson gave the Campers a 2-0 lead. Geatz assisted Cooper Willetts and Ives scored an unassisted goal to make it 4-0 before Geatz’s goal took the score to 5-0. 
Carter Willetts was assisted by McCloskey for the final goal. 
Allegany dominated 38-1 in shots and 8-0 in corner kicks. Campers’ goalie Isaac Bucy had one save, while Tyler Wilson made 17 for Keyser. 
Allegany (11-1, 6-1 AMAC) plays its Homecoming against Fort Hill Saturday. Keyser (7-8-1) hosts Hampshire Monday. 
TuesdayMountain Ridge 5Keyser 0 
KEYSER, W.Va. — Josh Trenum and Dylan Shimko assisted each other in the first half and Mountain Ridge added three more goals in the second half to beat Keyser in a 5-0 shutout Tuesday at Keyser. 
Trenum was assisted by Shimko with 15:55 remaining in the first half, and four minutes later he returned the favor by assisting Shimko for a 2-0 lead. 
Allan Green started scoring in the second half with an assist from Garrett Corley, and the Miners also got goals from Tyler Strawderman and Robin Godfrey in the second half. Logan Phillips assisted Strawderman and Haden DeHaven assisted Godfrey. 
The Miners led 8-1 in corner kicks, and got two saves from Caleb Ryan in the shutout. Tyler Wilson made 10 saves for Keyser. 
Mountain Ridge finishes the regular season Tuesday at Allegany. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
